titleInfo.title: Unidentified man posing on batture by a sloop with stern wheel paddle boat pushing a log raft in the background.

mods.note: 'Given the role of the Mississippi River as the nation's highway, the riverfront accommodated a wide range of watercraft from cargo hauling steamships to personal sailboats. The owner of the sailboat poses for a portrait while a pushboat guides a raft of logs downstream' â€“ Mark E. Martin, in Andrew D. Lytle's Baton Rouge: photographs 1863-1910, (Baton Rouge, LSU Press, 2008), p. 117.

titleInfo.title: Andrew D. Lytle's Baton Rouge' Photograph Collection/
